TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in the village PERSON , the ORG region . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , succeeded by Mr Y. GPE .

On DATE the ORG of Kharkiv ( ORG районний суд м. ORG ) awarded the applicant CARDINAL hryvnyas from the ORG budget for damage caused by criminal investigation against him terminated on exonerative grounds in DATE . This decision became final on DATE and was transferred for enforcement to ORG , which informed the applicant that the debt would be paid as soon as the Government allocated appropriate funding . In DATE the applicant received the payment due to him .
In the meantime , in DATE the applicant had lodged a civil complaint against ORG seeking damages for its alleged failure to ensure the timely enforcement of the judgment given in his favour .

Having heard both parties , on DATE the ORG of GPE ( ORG районний суд м. PERSON ) rejected the applicant ’s claims . It found no basis in the applicable law for the compensation claimed . The applicant appealed , alleging that the firstinstance court had misinterpreted his arguments and the applicable law .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON суд м. PERSON ) upheld the judgment of DATE , having held a hearing in the applicant ’s absence .

The applicant appealed in cassation . In his appeal , he noted that he had not been duly informed of the hearing of DATE , as the court had sent him the summons by regular mail , which arrived only on DATE .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal in cassation . In its decision , ORG did not refer to the applicant ’s argument about the deficient notification of the hearing . However , it stated generally that the case did not disclose any misapplication of procedural or substantive law , which could have led to an erroneous decision of the case .
